snippet: In the village of Fessenheim, an aging nuclear plant stirs both protests and support over the use of nuclear power across France.
abstract: Fessenheim Journal; aging nuclear plant in Fessenheim, France, that sits in a seismic zone stirs protests, including by Socialist Party presidential frontrunner Francois Hollande, who has pledged to close it if elected; some find his stance controversial, given France's decades of heavy investment in nuclear power and feelings of national pride and independence wrapped up in it.
lead_paragraph: In the village of Fessenheim, an aging nuclear plant stirs both protests and support over the use of nuclear power across France.

headline.main: Wishing Upon an Atom in a Tiny French Village
headline.print_headline: Wishing Upon an Atom in a Tiny French Village
